DOC.brief_summary: Acupuncture widely use manage acute chronic pain condition . In context emergency department ( ED ) , patient often present non-emergent acute pain symptom . This may result delayed triage process inefficient emergent management . An integrative patient-care approach emergency department explore may improve patient satisfaction promote efficient use healthcare resource non-emergent patient ED . This imply potential role acupuncture context . The aim pilot study ass effectiveness safety acupuncture add-on intervention patient non-emergent acute musculoskeletal pain primary headache ED set . Hypotheses study follow : 1 . A single session add-on acupuncture , standard ED management , reduce pain level non-emergent acute pain , compare standard ED management alone . 2 . A single session add-on acupuncture standard ED management reduce additional consumption healthcare resource management non-emergent acute pain , compare standard ED management alone . This study aim include 40 participant , 20 acupuncture plus standard ED management group 20 standard ED management alone group .
DOC.criteria: Aged 19 year acute pain defined pain occur within 72 hour ED presentation Acute neck pain evidence neurological abnormality Acute headache meet classification criterion primary headache describe International Headache Society ( code 1 4 ) Acute ankle injury evidence fracture complete tear ligament Any suspected nonmusculoskeletal cause ( neoplasm neurological complication ) neck ankle pain Any suspect secondary headache classify code 5 12 International Classification Headache Disorders , 2nd edition Pain due bone fracture joint dislocation Pain fever ( defined temperature 37.5 Â°C ) Inappropriate ED physician 's discretion Pain level less 4 point pain intensity Numerical Rating Scale ( NRS ) ( range 0 10 ) completion observation standard ED management Pregnant woman
